alert.note: Alert for Kennebec; Sagadahoc (Maine) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued May 02 at 4:47AM EDT until May 03 at 11:30PM EDT by NWS Gray/Portland
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Maine... Androscoggin River Near Auburn affecting Androscoggin, Sagadahoc and Cumberland Counties. Kennebec River at Hallowell affecting Kennebec and Sagadahoc Counties. Kennebec River At North Sidney affecting Kennebec County. Sandy River At Mercer affecting Somerset and Franklin Counties. ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Maine... New Hampshire... Kennebec River At Skowhegan affecting Kennebec and Somerset Counties. Androscoggin River At Rumford affecting Androscoggin, Oxford and Franklin Counties. Kennebec River At Augusta affecting Kennebec County. Suncook River At North Chichester affecting Merrimack and Belknap Counties. ...The Flood Warning is cancelled for the following rivers in Maine...New Hampshire... Saco River At Conway affecting Cumberland, Oxford and Carroll Counties. Warner River At Davisville affecting Merrimack County. For the Androscoggin River...including Gorham, Rumford, Auburn... Minor flooding is forecast. For the Kennebec River...including Skowhegan, North Sidney, Augusta, Hallowell...Moderate flooding is forecast. For the Sandy River...including Mercer...Minor flooding is forecast. For the Suncook River...including North Chichester...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL LATE TOMORROW EVENING... * WHAT...Moderate flooding is occurring and moderate flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Kennebec River at Hallowell. * WHEN...Until late tomorrow evening. * IMPACTS...At 11.0 feet, Parking lots along Front Street begin to flood. Town dock begins to flood. At 13.0 feet, Water enters the back side of buildings along Water Street. Front Street becomes completely submerged. The parking lot by town dock flood. At 18.0 feet, Water enters Water St (Route 27/ Route 201). * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 4:24 AM EDT Tuesday the stage was 16.3 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 4:24 AM EDT Tuesday was 16.4 feet. - Forecast...The river will oscillate above flood stage with a maximum value of 17.5 feet this afternoon. It will fall below flood stage tomorrow afternoon. - Flood stage is 11.0 feet. &&
info.instruction: Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely. Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/gray.
